extsInput.title: Supported Media Types Extensions
extsInput.name: extsInput
extsInput.description:
Only input media types are allowed to be uploaded to Media Kit.
Each extension can be split using the ',' symbols. Not allowed to contain ‘*’. If this item is empty, then .jpeg, .png, .gif, .svg, .webp, .bmp, .ico will be allowed.

maxUploadSize.title: Maximum File Upload Size
maxUploadSize.name: maxUploadSize
maxUploadSize.description: Set the max upload size limit when uploading files(should be a valid byte string, examples: 1MB, 200kb). If empty, not limit max upload size.

checkReferer.title: Hotlink Protection (Beta)
checkReferer.description: When Hotlink Protection is enabled, only requests from blocklet trusted domains can access the resources.
checkReferer.name: checkReferer

useAiImage.title: Use AI Image
useAiImage.description: The ability to generate images using AI
useAiImage.name: useAiImage

supportModels.title: Supported Models
supportModels.name: supportModels
supportModels.description: Available AI models. You can specify multiple models separated by commas, and use wildcard patterns (e.g., dall-e-2, gpt-*).

imagePromptTemplate.title: Image Prompt Template
imagePromptTemplate.name: imagePromptTemplate
imagePromptTemplate.description: An Image Prompt Template ensures the AI always generates an image, not text.
imagePromptTemplate.default: You are an advanced image generation model. Your task is to produce a **single high-quality image** strictly based on the user's request. You **must output only image data** (no text, no descriptions, no metadata, no explanations).  Image Generation Requirements: 1. **Output Type**:    * Return an **image only**, never text.    * If you would normally describe or explain something, **do not** — instead, directly generate the visual result.  2. **Style Handling**:    * Use the style explicitly requested by the user.    * If the user does not specify a style, infer the most visually appropriate style from their description (e.g., realistic, illustration, minimalist, futuristic, cinematic, etc.).  3. **Composition & Quality**:    * Create a coherent, visually appealing composition.    * Include appropriate details, lighting, and visual clarity.    * If the user’s description is incomplete or vague, reasonably fill in missing visual details to ensure the final image looks complete and aesthetically balanced.  4. **Technical Specifications**:    * Resolution: High-quality output    * Follow the user’s content instructions exactly while maintaining strong visual fidelity.  5. **Safety**:    * Ensure the generated content complies with safety policies.    * Do not generate harmful, sensitive, or restricted material.  6. **Fallback Rules**:    * Under no circumstances should you return text in place of an image.    * If the instruction seems ambiguous, interpret it visually rather than returning or explaining text.    * Always prioritize producing an actual image output.  User request:
